intro: Glochidion wagapense, commonly known as the Philippine glabrous hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers with five petals, often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
